channel.title: Player with a command enabled can't go in wildy? Will rep++

item.title: Player with a command enabled can't go in wildy? Will rep++
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

The Soul:

You’d need a value added to the player tokens that checks the player’s coordinates and the isWiilderness() method.

Err, this to a degree. I don’t really understand what the OP means, is he trying to add a check to make sure players can’t enter the wilderness as an egg?

If that’s the case then just add a wilderness check i.e: (If you get errors you can fix them ;), they’re probably just due to incorrect variable naming of the wilderness check).

if(c.isInWild()) { //Is the player in the wilderness? Yes ((Client) player).sendMessage("message here"); //Your message contents here return; //If I am correct, this method is a void so just return the method function }

Read full topic
item.source: Player with a command enabled can't go in wildy? Will rep++

[/quote]
If he did that you’d never learn… Actually, please do explain so i could learn also :3.[/quote]
Lawl. I’m sort’ve new to java, but adding so much more advanced stuff with tutorials.

item.title: Player with a command enabled can't go in wildy? Will rep++
item.dc:creator: @joelandjacob joelandjacob
item.description:
@joelandjacob wrote:

How would I make it so a player with a command enabled go into the wilderness?

My command:

if(playerCommand.startsWith("egg")) {
	c.isNpc = true;
	c.npcId2 = 3689;
	c.sendMessage("You are now a egg! Relog to unmorph!");
	c.updateRequired = true;
	c.appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}

What this does is display you as a green egg, just like the easter ring. Using the command pnpc. (Not displayed, just same form)

So if that is enabled, maybe like “c.isNpc = true;” can’t enter wilderness.
What code would I add?

Read full topic
item.source: Player with a command enabled can't go in wildy? Will rep++
